links.*: The Disaster of the Gladden Fields

wikitext.*:
The '''eket''' was a short stabbing sword wielded by the [[Númenóreans]]. It was described as ''"a short stabbing sword with a broad blade, pointed and two-edged, from a foot to one and a half feet long."''<ref>{{UT|Gladden}}, note 28</ref> It also can be assumed that it was longer at times and similar in appearance to [[Daggers of Westernesse|Barrow-blades]].{{Fact}}

[[Isildur]] carried one on his way to [[Arnor]]. While escaping the [[Disaster of the Gladden Fields]], he retained the eket after discarding the rest of his war gear to swim across [[Anduin]].

== Inspiration ==
The sword's description is similar in many ways to the ''[[Wikipedia:Gladius|Gladius]]'' carried by Roman legionnaires. It also is similar to some European long daggers.
